title: Energy & Forces Assessment Exam
description: Comprehensive assessment of energy and force concepts

questions.question: A book sitting on a high shelf has what type of energy?
questions.explanation: The book has potential energy because it is at a height. If it falls, the potential energy will become kinetic energy.

questions.question: Balanced forces cause objects to change speed or direction.
questions.explanation: Balanced forces are equal and opposite, so they cancel out and don't cause changes in motion. Unbalanced forces cause changes in speed or direction.

questions.question: What energy transformation happens when you eat food and then ride your bike?
questions.explanation: Food contains chemical energy, which your body transforms into kinetic energy (motion) when you ride your bike.

questions.question: The force that opposes motion and slows things down is called _______.
questions.explanation: Friction is the force that occurs when surfaces rub together, and it always opposes motion.

questions.question: Which surface would create the MOST friction?
questions.explanation: Sandpaper is very rough, so it creates the most friction. Smoother surfaces like ice and glass create less friction.

questions.question: A car moving down the road has both kinetic energy and potential energy.
questions.explanation: The car has kinetic energy because it's moving. It also has potential energy based on its height above ground level (even if it's small).

questions.question: What must happen for an object at rest to start moving?
options: Balanced forces must act on it
Unbalanced forces must act on it
questions.explanation: An unbalanced force (where one force is stronger than others) is needed to start an object moving or change its motion.

questions.question: A ball rolls down a ramp. Describe the energy transformation that occurs.
questions.correctAnswer: Potential energy changes to kinetic energy
questions.explanation: At the top, the ball has potential energy from its height. As it rolls down, the potential energy transforms into kinetic energy (motion).
